name: Ocean Commotion
description:
**PLEASE PLAY ON FULL SCREEN**

I'm a 3rd year zoology student at Exeter University, and we were tasked with the creation of something which engages the public in science.

I chose to make a short game intended to accompany an aquarium or museum exhibit about marine noise and its impacts on wildlife, aimed primarily at 6-12 year olds as a learning reinforcement.  

In the game, you control Blue, a lost whale trying to get home to her family.

It's the first game I've made so not the most polished, but I'm pretty proud of it.
